definitions.definition: To stick out from a surface without breaking it.
examples: He stood six feet tall, with muscular arms bulging out of his black T-shirt.

definitions.definition: To have the surface stretched by something pushing out; to swell ; to belly .
examples: The submarine bulged because of the enormous air pressure inside.

definitions.definition: To bilge , as a ship; to founder .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To stick out from a surface without breaking it.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) (of a container, etc.) To have the surface stretched by something pushing out; to swell ; to belly .
( intransitive ) To bilge , as a ship; to founder .
